entry.title: Automatically annotate dangling ExperimentalAsh pointers [8/N]
entry.content:
This patch is:

- Automated. See [automation] section.

- Not affecting users, only Chrome's CQ. See [no-op] section.



This is a split affecting:

- chrome/browser/ash/

- chrome/browser/chromeos/

- chrome/browser/ui/ash/



Context:

--------

@bartekn is going to remove the `ExperimentalAsh` raw_ptr annotation.

This was a performance experiment to enable/disable MiraclePtr on a

subset of new pointers added for ChromeOS ash (non-lacros).



Before removing it, he needs to enable it by default in code. Enabling

MiraclePtr for them, causes the DanglingPointerDetector to be enforced.

To pass the CQ, we need to annotate pre-existing dangling pointer with

`DanglingUntriaged`. After enabling ExperimentalAsh feature, it won't be

allowed anymore for those pointers to become dangling.



Automation:

-----------

1. Enable the `PartitionAllocBackupRefPtrForAsh` feature flag.

2. Apply the 'annotator' CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4474553

3. Run all the gtests. See https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AMMERcqy0eafFWopUCHYsIKIKEp3J8DFxqW9UIbzIHo

4. Concatenate all the output_*, `filter`, `sort -nr`, `uniq`.

5. Run https://github.com/ArthurSonzogni/chrome-dangling-ptr-apply-edit

6. Run `git cl format`

7. Cherry-pick the patch created from (5)



no-op:

------

The DanglingPointerDetector is not enabled against users. It only

affects tests and chromium developers.



Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chrome.try:chromeos-betty-pi-arc-chrome;luci.chrome.try:linux-chromeos-chrome

AX-Relnotes: n/a.

Bug: chromium:1441101

Change-Id: I786b16353b4db1929771bd44bb3b57c0cf6b63db

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4778505

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Commit-Queue: Arthur Sonzogni

Owners-Override: Daniel Cheng

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1184799}

entry.title: Add IPH to the BrowserCommandHandler's open Enhanced Protection flow
entry.content:
The previous implementation would direct the user to the safe browsing

settings on chrome://settings/security and open the Enhanced Protection

section. This change maintains that behavior but adds opening an

in-product help bubble to the sequence.



Opening the settings page with an in-product help bubble was previously

added to promotions from the security interstitial pages. This change

moves that logic to chrome/browser/ui/chrome_pages.h so that it can be

more easily reused across different components.



Also moves the SafeBrowsingSettingReferralMethod enum to the

safe_browsing:: namespace.

entry.title: [Lacros A11y] Send STS context clicks from Lacros to Ash
entry.content:
Select to Speak can now be started from Lacros context menu

shown when there is a document selection.



This changes adds the crosapi plumbing that sends the context

menu click from EmbeddedA11yManagerLacros to AccessibilityManager

in Ash.



See go/lacros-embedded-a11y-extensions (subsection of larger

Lacros a11y doc) for background and design.



Note the command line flag to Lacros must be set in

ash_browser_test_starter because it needs to be combined

with other Lacros flags (rather than being sent separately

from the JS test). Since this flag only influences whether

an API is available for Select to Speak in Lacros, it seems

safe to turn on for all tests.



Bug: b/286413297

entry.title: Android: Turn off caching for jar_utils
entry.content:
Since ninja already checks timestamps and only re-compiles what is

needed in a new build, this caching is of limited benefit. Caching

also fails for some bots. Turning it off in order to avoid bot

failures.



Each dependency analysis run will be about a minute slower without

caching, but since it is usually run on a bot continuously, the impact

for devs is very limited.

entry.title: ARC testing: builder for ARC task windows (reland)
entry.content:
This has come up in a few places so replace all of them with a single

solution.



Many tests allowed never specifying a shell root surface, and only two

seemed to require it, in autotest_private_apitest.cc and

arc_graphics_tracing_handler_unittest.cc (SwitchWindowDuringModelBuild).



I prefer not creating a root surface automatically, as this can result

in multiple root surfaces in the case that multiple windows are created,

and the surface destruction also becomes implicit, both of which may be

surprising. Another potential issue is that there will be fragmentation

on style where some callers will prefer to explicitly make the surface

(which only requires two very short additional lines) and some will use

the implicit style.



I ran into strange failures in the autotest_private_apitest.cc case

until I explicitly removed focus from the ARC window. It also was not

explicitly closing the window, so I used the OwnsNativeWidget style with

autoptr rather than use a raw pointer. These two changes may have been

interrelated.



This relands commit ca5e651d043d79294ab887dadec4376203320848. Avoid the

msan error by not default-initializing a raw_ptr.



Unit tests below were run with:



$ xvfb-run tools/autotest.py -C $outdir ...



with is_msan=true in gn.args.



Test: chrome/browser/ash/extensions/autotest_private/autotest_private_apitest.cc

Test: chrome/browser/ui/webui/ash/arc_graphics_tracing/arc_graphics_tracing_handler_unittest.cc

Test: chrome/browser/ash/arc/tracing/arc_app_performance_tracing_unittest.cc

Test: autoninja -C chrome chrome_sandbox nacl_helper

entry.title: IndexedDB: make leveldb encoding/decoding slightly stricter
entry.content:
Keys with type IDBKeyType::Min should not be considered a valid

IndexedDBKey. This key type is never encoded in the LevelDB backing

store as an IndexedDBKey, nor should it ever be passed from renderer

to browser.



Likewise, we never write kIndexedDBKeyNullTypeByte for an IndexedDBKey

and therefore should never need to decode one. (If data were corrupted,

we might run into this, but then decoding should fail rather than

returning an invalid IndexedDBKey.)



kIndexedDBKeyNullTypeByte and kIndexedDBKeyMinKeyTypeByte are used as

placeholder values when encoding/decoding cursors and indexes.



This fixes an issue flagged by the fuzzer.

entry.title: Avoid costly recalculation in holding space on drag updates.
entry.content:
Holding space currently recalculates whether a drag-and-drop payload

can be dropped on the holding space tray at each drag update. It

appears that it is not currently possible for the payload to change

mid drag-and-drop sequence, so this CL caches the value for reuse.



Note that this CL adds some DCHECKs to offer some protection against

assumptions breaking down, but these should not negatively affect

performance when expensive DCHECKs are disabled.

entry.title: Add DXC DLLs to Chrome installer
entry.content:
This adds 2 files, dxcompiler.dll and dxil.dll, to the installer if

GN arg `dawn_use_built_dxc` is true.



* dxcompiler.dll is the core DXC library, and is built from source by

Dawn when `dawn_use_built_dxc` is true (currently false for Chrome).



* dxil.dll is Microsoft's DXIL signing DLL. When `dawn_use_built_dxc`

is true, the latest version of this file is copied from the platform

SDK.



Note that the main reason for building dxcompiler.dll from source

rather than using official releases from Microsoft is that it allows us

to address security issues more quickly.



Note that renaming dxcompiler.dll to something else in order to clarify

that it is not the official MS version was considered; however, renaming

it breaks the CLI tool dxc.exe. Instead, the metadata for the DLL will

clearly state that it is a DLL built for Google Dawn.



Note that after this lands, the plan is to do a Finch trial where some

Chrome instances will use DXC, while others use FXC. The plan is to set

dawn_use_built_dxc to true in Chrome, and use a Finch flag to drive

Dawn's "use_dxc" flag. If all goes well with the trial, we will remove

dawn_use_built_dxc as it will become the default.



Bug: dawn:1862

entry.title: Defer source/trigger JSON parsing to interop execution
entry.content:
Instead of parsing registrations during interop-test instantiation, we

defer parsing until the test is being run. This increases the testable

surface area and makes execution more closely resemble the real behavior

of the API, which parses registrations at the time they arrive.



We allow the registrations themselves to be arbitrary JSON, instead of

requiring them to be dictionaries at instantiation time, in order to

further increase the testable surface area.

Now that M117 is branched and TabGroupsContinuationAndroid is the

default everywhere the old flags for the initial development of the Grid

Tab Switcher can finally be cleaned up.

everywhere. This flag has been defaulted to enabled for a long time

although TabGroupsContinuationAndroid remains gating its behavior.

until the TabGroupsContinuationAndroid flag is also removed.

entry.title: [AutofillDataModel] Add heuristic predictions override for overflow.
entry.content:
For recently introduced types, sometimes we want to prioritize local

heuristics over the autocomplete attribute or predictions returned by

the server. It is possible that the newly introduced types do not do not

have a clear corresponding HTML type or that the server might have

learnt incorrect predictions for those fields.



This CL introduces such an override for address overflow field types.

entry.title: Reland "[Auto-disable Accessibility] Point ChromeAccessibilityUtil to AccessibilityState"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 8d93191c13dfcc46850977db1dfce4fe2c5ca78c



Original change's description:

> [Auto-disable Accessibility] Point ChromeAccessibilityUtil to AccessibilityState

>

> This CL continues the work to consolidate all accessibility state

> management in Clank to a single source, AccessibilityState.java.

>

> With this CL we point the ChromeAccessibilityUtil to use

> AccessibilityState so that under-the-hood all parts of the Clank

> code-base are running off the same accessibility state engine.

> We do not remove the ChromeAccessibilityUtil to keep the code

> change small, and after some general usage and manual testing

> we will follow-up with a series of CLs to completely remove

> the ChromeAccessibilityUtil class.

>

> The implementation in AccessibilityState matches the previous

> existing impl of ChromeAccessibilityUtil, i.e. checking if

> accessibility is enabled is equivalent to asking: "is there a

> service that uses touch exploration enabled, OR, is there a

> service that requested to perform gestures enabled." This is

> subtly different than what AccessibilityState will consider as

> "enabled" in the future, since it provides more granularity in

> state information. As we move to AccessibilityState, we will

> audit usages and see if a more granular check can be applied on

> a case-by-case basis.

>

> AX-Relnotes: N/A

> Bug: 1430202, b/265493191

> Change-Id: I5757a4d2dc426a9c58107de4ca56ccf456d33968

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4753000

entry.title: [iOS] Fixed BrowserStateInfoCache not updating on signin
entry.content:
Previously, when users would attempt to signin to Chrome without

enrolling in Sync, the BrowserStateInfoCache was never updated with the

user's username and gaia ID.



In this CL, the threshold for updating the BrowserStateInfoCache was

changed from signin::ConsentLevel::kSync to

signin::ConsentLevel::kSignin.



Fixed: 1445551

entry.title: Update Mac ContextMenu Event Timestamps
entry.content:
MessagePumpNSApplication::DoQuit generates an application defined event.

This is currently generated with a null timestamp.



RenderWidgetHostViewCocoa setShowingContextMenu eventually receives one

of these events and converts it into a WebMouseEvent.



EventLatencyTracingRecorder throws an error when processing null

timestamps, in order to catch regressions that may affect UMA Guardrail

Metrics. Recently coverage for Mouse Move events was added:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4278310



This lead to ContextMenuBrowserTest.BackAfterBackEntryRemoved failing

with this detection.



This change updated RenderWidgetHostViewCocoa setShowingContextMenu to

get the current time when creating the WebMouseEvent. There is

precedent in the class for other events doing the same.



We are not updating MessagePumpNSApplication::DoQuit at this time as it

utilizes otherEventWithType which truncates the time to seconds. Which

would lead to events being out-of-order.



TEST=ContextMenuBrowserTest.BackAfterBackEntryRemoved



Bug: 1465562

Change-Id: I3df099b70c4e17c309953b5fcb9edf57d10b573d

entry.title: Obtain AutofillClient from WebContents in driver constructor.
entry.content:
Currently, there is a call chain from ChromeAutofillClient to

ContentPasswordManagerDriverFactory to ContentPasswordManagerDriver

to PasswordAutocompleteManager that does nothing but pass through

a AutofillClient pointer.

This is used only in tests and not necessary: If one wishes to inject a

(Test)AutofillClient, then that client can be injected into the

WebContents using the TestAutofillClientInjector.



This CL therefore gets the AutofillClient directly from WebContents and

removes the AutofillClient argument in ContentPasswordManagerDriver's

constructor. A follow-up CL will remove the arguments also in the

driver factory and ChromeAutofillClient.

entry.title: [BlobURL] Re-enable new blob URL architecture by default
entry.content:
This was enabled and then disabled due to an increase in

renderer hangs, but after investigating further it seems

plausible that this higher (but stable) number of

renderer hangs is inherent in using a synchronous Mojo

interface method of a navigation-associated interface

between the renderer and the browser process UI thread

(or at least is a side effect of some unknown issue that

causes the browser process to not respond to the messages

in a timely manner).



This requires temporarily disabling

kRestrictCanAccessDataForOriginToUIThread due to issues

that arise when both flags are enabled. For more info,

see:

- https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4764617/comments/850fbb6b_b25fed3c

- https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=764958#c54



Bug: 764958, 1407944

entry.title: [@scope] Prepend implicitly nested rule with kScopeActivation
entry.content:
This CL fixes an issue when @scope is a nested group rule.



Consider the following example:



.a {

@scope (.b) {

color: green;

}

}



We incorrectly inserted an implicit &-rule, making it

equivalent to:



.a {

@scope (.b) {

& { color: green; }

}

}



When we should have inserted an implicit :scope-rule:



.a {

@scope (.b) {

:scope { color: green; }

}

}



Since the implicit &-rule lacked a kScopeActivation, the rule would

never match.



Fixed: 1456435

Change-Id: I885dbb2e2588e3f2421b5bb3cf4f31376443f2ff

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4780629

entry.title: Add WPT tests of clip-path on SVG defaulting to use the stroke-box
entry.content:
This patch adds two WPT tests covering the following lines from

http://www.w3.org/TR/css-masking-1/#the-clip-path:

1. If no reference box is specified, the border-box will be used as

reference box.

2. For SVG elements without an associated CSS layout box, the used

value for ... border-box and margin-box is stroke-box.

entry.title: Automatically annotate dangling ExperimentalAsh pointers [9/N]
entry.content:
This patch is:

- Automated. See [automation] section.

- Not affecting users, only Chrome's CQ. See [no-op] section.



This is a split affecting:

- ash/

- chrome/browser/ui/ash/



Context:

--------

@bartekn is going to remove the `ExperimentalAsh` raw_ptr annotation.

This was a performance experiment to enable/disable MiraclePtr on a

subset of new pointers added for ChromeOS ash (non-lacros).



Before removing it, he needs to enable it by default in code. Enabling

MiraclePtr for them, causes the DanglingPointerDetector to be enforced.

To pass the CQ, we need to annotate pre-existing dangling pointer with

`DanglingUntriaged`. After enabling ExperimentalAsh feature, it won't be

allowed anymore for those pointers to become dangling.



Automation:

-----------

1. Enable the `PartitionAllocBackupRefPtrForAsh` feature flag.

2. Apply the 'annotator' CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4474553

3. Run all the gtests. See https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AMMERcqy0eafFWopUCHYsIKIKEp3J8DFxqW9UIbzIHo

4. Concatenate all the output_*, `filter`, `sort -nr`, `uniq`.

5. Run https://github.com/ArthurSonzogni/chrome-dangling-ptr-apply-edit

6. Run `git cl format`

7. Cherry-pick the patch created from (5)



no-op:

------

The DanglingPointerDetector is not enabled against users. It only

affects tests and chromium developers.

entry.title: Pass RestoreToDestinationIOTask's ID to its Move task
entry.content:
Copies the RestoreToDestinationIOTask's ID to its underlying

CopyOrMoveIOTask, in order for all actions on the move task (like pause,

resume, etc.) to actually be invoked on the restore task.



The RestoreToDestinationIOTask delegates these to the move task, but it's still required as normally the move task wouldn't have a valid (tracked) ID and callers like the FilesPolicyNotificationManager wouldn't be able to pause/resume/cancel it in case of policy restrictions, which can apply in case the user tries to restore the trashed file to a component restricted by DLP (Drive, USB, etc.).



R=lucmult@chromium.org



Bug: b:294537092

entry.title: url() should resolve to an invalid URL
entry.content:
Per https://drafts.csswg.org/css-values/#url-empty



Add CSSParserContext::CompleteNonEmptyURL for this semantic. Although

all current users of the existing CSSParserContext::CompleteURL() should be switched over, said function is kept around as an analog to

Document::CompleteURL (and similar).



Make sure that re-resolve (where applicable) also respect this property.



Simplify CSSFontFaceSrcValue::RestoreCachedResourceIfNeeded - the

absolute variant of the URL shouldn't need (re)resolving so just use the

single argument KURL constructor.



Fix CSSURIValue::ComputedCSSValue's handling of the `is_local_` flag

while updating that function.



Fixed: 910954

entry.title: [Files app] Ducks proposal - convert search
entry.content:
Convert the search slice to using the ducks pattern, serving

as an example to future conversions of other store slices.



This is the first piece of the duck proposal. It offers a new

API to create action dispatchers for actions that are only handled

by a single reducer.



It leverages the code reduction to bundle `search` actions with

their corresponding reducers into a single file in the ducks folder.



Changes to the `search` slice were previously spread across 4 files:



* actions/search.ts

* reducers/search.ts

* reducers/root.ts

* state/actions.ts



Now they can be found in a single file:



* ducks/search.ts



Bug: None

Test: browser_tests *FilesAppBrowserTest.Test*

Change-Id: I19b0b59dc5332bffc0c27c4c4015cdca1d21e823

entry.title: [Passwords] Convert sharing public key to base64
entry.content:
Bytes from x25519_public_key proto may not match valid utf-8 characters.

Conversion to Base64 prevents further errors while converting string to

different types. Also, this helps with debugging by verifying the public keys from `chrome.passwordsPrivate.fetchFamilyMembers` match with ones

in chrome://sync-internals.

entry.title: Fix dangling ExperimentalAsh pointers [4/N]
entry.content:
ExperimentalAsh pointers are not (yet) subject to MiraclePtr and the

DanglingPointerDetector.



In order to enable them, we need to fix or annotate every dangling

pointer. There is one in this test. The pointer should have been a

std::unique_ptr, but couldn't because the object destructor is private.



This patch uses raw_ptr::ExtractAsDangling() to clear the pointer

when deleting the object. It avoids the pointer to be dangling

after the delete instruction. Note that we can't use std::unique_ptr

or raw_ptr::ClearAndDelete() because the destructor is private.



Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chrome.try:chromeos-betty-pi-arc-chrome;luci.chrome.try:linux-chromeos-chrome

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointers in CreditCardFidoAuthenticator.
entry.content:
This CL addresses a dangling pointer that can occur outside of tests as

follows:

- CreditCardAccessManager owns a CreditCard and a

CreditCardFidoAuthenticator.

- CreditCardFidoAuthenticator stores a raw pointer to the CreditCard

when CreditCardFidoAuthenticator::Authenticate is called.

- CreditCardFidoAuthenticator owns a FullCardRequest, which, on

completion or failure, calls CreditCardFidoAuthenticator::OnFido*.

This, in turn, calls

CreditCardAccessManager::OnFIDOAuthenticationComplete, which calls

CreditCardAccessManager::Reset that deletes the CreditCard, to which

the CreditCardFidoAuthenticator still has a raw pointer.



This CL resolves this by keeping a copy of the CreditCard instead of

maintaining a pointer.



Bug: 1468967

Change-Id: Id1bdcfcc3430a663040cfad908316519870dbd71

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4777249

Reviewed-by: Olivia Saul

Commit-Queue: Jan Keitel

entry.title: Hide Autofill Popup if hidden behind Pip window
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/3959939 introduced the logic to hide the autofill popup if

it is hidden behind the picture-in-picture window. This check was added

at the time of the autofill popup initialization.



However, picture-in-picture window can still hide the autofill popup

if picture-in-picture window is opened after a certain delay. This CL

prevents this by listening to the events sent by picture-in-picture

window and hiding the window when a picture-in-picture window is

to be presented.



See go/pip-autofill-security-bug for more details.



Bug: 1395164

Change-Id: Ib8d50764f975109afe027f277b4fed81d277a92a

entry.title: Make migrating snapshot more efficient
entry.content:
Migrating snapshot at launch had a catastrophic performance, as it

loaded all snapshots from disk into memory at once.



This CL prevents the round-trip through memory for unloaded images.

For those, it just moves the files on disk.



Before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/4ULRGdvVNAsKhja

After: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8nxjhQLjxkfjCCf

entry.title: Automatically annotate dangling ExperimentalAsh pointers [7/N]
entry.content:
This patch is:

- Automated. See [automation] section.

- Not affecting users, only Chrome's CQ. See [no-op] section.



This is a split affecting:

- chromeos/



Context:

--------

@bartekn is going to remove the `ExperimentalAsh` raw_ptr annotation.

This was a performance experiment to enable/disable MiraclePtr on a

subset of new pointers added for ChromeOS ash (non-lacros).



Before removing it, he needs to enable it by default in code. Enabling

MiraclePtr for them, causes the DanglingPointerDetector to be enforced.

To pass the CQ, we need to annotate pre-existing dangling pointer with

`DanglingUntriaged`. After enabling ExperimentalAsh feature, it won't be

allowed anymore for those pointers to become dangling.



Automation:

-----------

1. Enable the `PartitionAllocBackupRefPtrForAsh` feature flag.

2. Apply the 'annotator' CL: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4474553

3. Run all the gtests. See https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AMMERcqy0eafFWopUCHYsIKIKEp3J8DFxqW9UIbzIHo

4. Concatenate all the output_*, `filter`, `sort -nr`, `uniq`.

5. Run https://github.com/ArthurSonzogni/chrome-dangling-ptr-apply-edit

6. Run `git cl format`

7. Cherry-pick the patch created from (5)



no-op:

------

The DanglingPointerDetector is not enabled against users. It only

affects tests and chromium developers.

entry.title: Make track.getFrameStats() work when cloning or disabling the track.
entry.content:
When cloning a track, the stats counters should have a baseline of

zero. This is automatically true for `deliveredFrames` since frame

delivery counters are handled by MediaStreamVideoTrack already.



But this is not true of the video's source, since the same source can

be shared by multiple tracks cloned at multiple times or having been

enabled or disabled at different points in time.



In order to make track counters work as expected, each track gets its

own `baseline_discarded_frames_` and `baseline_dropped_frames_`

counters.



An alternative would be to move the frame counters to

MediaStreamTrackImpl, but that would require wiring up the

OnFrameDropped event further and I prefer to keep those counters on

the source level in case we want to refactor the threading assumptions

of OnFrameDropped (I would argue we do!).



Bug: chromium:1472978
